import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

sns.pairplot(df_grp,x_vars=['yearsofexperience'],y_vars=['totalyearlycompensation'],size=7,kind='scatter')

plt.ylabel('Total yearly Compensation')
plt.title('Salaries in STEM')

# Import Segregating data from scikit learn
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
source.4cf95b5d:
# Split the data for train and test 
X_train,X_test,y_train,y_test = train_test_split(X,y,train_size=0.7,random_state=100)
source.4001a09b:
#Code by Barath https://www.kaggle.com/vivinbarath/simple-linear-regression-for-salary-data

# Create new axis for x column
X_train = X_train[:,np.newaxis]
X_test = X_test[:,np.newaxis]
source.898f7d71:
# Importing Linear Regression model from scikit learn
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
source.d36bc736:
# Fitting the model
lr = LinearRegression()
lr.fit(X_train,y_train)
source.26a889a7:
# Predicting the Salary for the Test values
y_pred = lr.predict(X_test)
source.3ebb4a7c:
#Code by Barath https://www.kaggle.com/vivinbarath/simple-linear-regression-for-salary-data

# Plotting the actual and predicted values

c = [i for i in range (1,len(y_test)+1,1)]
plt.plot(c,y_test,color='r',linestyle='-')
plt.plot(c,y_pred,color='b',linestyle='-')
plt.xlabel('Base Salary')
plt.ylabel('index')
plt.title('Prediction')
plt.show()
source.5fa3817d:
#Code by Barath https://www.kaggle.com/vivinbarath/simple-linear-regression-for-salary-data

# plotting the error
c = [i for i in range(1,len(y_test)+1,1)]
plt.plot(c,y_test-y_pred,color='green',linestyle='-')
plt.xlabel('index')
plt.ylabel('Error')
plt.title('Error Value')
plt.show()
source.f94bcb7e:
# Importing metrics for the evaluation of the model
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score,mean_squared_error
source.18044e3e:
# calculate Mean square error
mse = mean_squared_error(y_test,y_pred)
source.1b35e55d:

rsq = r2_score(y_test,y_pred)

##Code by Taha07  https://www.kaggle.com/taha07/data-scientists-jobs-analysis-visualization/notebook

from wordcloud import WordCloud
from wordcloud import STOPWORDS
stopwords = set(STOPWORDS)
wordcloud = WordCloud(background_color = 'black',
                      colormap='Set3',
                      height =2000,
                      width = 2000
                     ).generate(str(df["company"]))
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = (12,12)
plt.axis("off")
plt.imshow(wordcloud)
plt.title("STEM Companies")
plt.show()
